ChatGPT said:

It looks like your code is quite clean, but I noticed a few things that may need adjustments or improvement. I'll go through them:

Issues:

  1. v-model for VDateInput:
    You're using v-model="localRange", but the VDateInput component in Vuetify might expect a different type for its v-model. It expects a string | string[] based on your code, but you might want to ensure it handles the value correctly with the date range.

  2. clearable prop:
    Vuetify's VDateInput has a clearable prop. You're passing true, which is good, but ensure that the handling of the model reflects this (it clears localRange when clicked).

  3. Date Formatting:
    You're using formatDate for formatting the date, but this function may be redundant if the input type is already formatted correctly. Alternatively, you can make the date formatting more flexible.

  4. handleInput function:
    It appears that handleInput and updateModel may overlap in their responsibilities. Both are handling the same @input and @blur events, so you may want to consolidate them to avoid redundancy.

Improvements:

  1. Refine v-model binding for VDateInput:
    Consider using a more explicit model-binding strategy for the VDateInput component if it needs to track the range of dates and handle null or empty values.

  2. Remove Redundant handleInput:
    You might not need both handleInput and updateModel, as they appear to perform similar actions.

  3. Conditionally handle inputData.type for non-date fields:
    If inputData.type isn't 'date_range', make sure your <v-input> handles various types (like text, number, etc.).

Updated Code:

Hereâ€™s a refined version of the script and template:

vue
<template>
  <div class="input-wrapper">
    <label
      :for="inputData.name"
      class="input-label"
      :class="{ required: inputData.config?.required }"
    >
      {{ inputData.label }}
    </label>

    <!-- Date Range Input -->
    <template v-if="inputData.type === 'date_range'">
      <v-date-input
        :min="inputData.config?.min"
        :max="inputData.config?.edit ?? inputData.config?.max"
        v-model="localRange"
        :label="inputData.config?.edit ? `${inputData.config?.min} - ${inputData.config?.max}` : inputData.placeholder"
        :multiple="inputData.config?.multiple ? 'range' : false"
        :placeholder="inputData.placeholder"
        max-width="auto"
        variant="outlined"
        prepend-inner-icon="mdi-calendar"
        bg-color="background"
        @update:modelValue="onRangeChange"
        color="primary"
        :clearable="true"
        header-color="primary"
      />
    </template>

    <!-- Regular Input Fields -->
    <template v-else>
      <v-input
        :name="inputData.name"
        :id="inputData.name"
        :type="inputData.type"
        :placeholder="inputData.label"
        @input="updateModel"
        @blur="handleInput"
        class="input"
        :class="{ error: inputData.error && inputData.error.length > 0 }"
      />
    </template>

    <!-- Error Messages -->
    <div>
      <span
        v-for="(error, index) in inputData.error"
        :key="index"
        class="showError"
      >
        {{ error }}
      </span>
    </div>
  </div>
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref, watch } from "vue";
import { VDateInput } from "vuetify/labs/components";
import { Input } from "@/types/interface";

const props = defineProps({
  inputData: {
    type: Object as () => Input,
    required: true,
  },
  modelValue: {
    type: String,
    required: true,
  },
});
const emit = defineEmits(["update", "updateModel"]);

// Local state for the date range
const localRange = ref<string[]>(
  Array.isArray(props.modelValue) ? props.modelValue : []
);

// Watch for changes in modelValue
watch(
  () => props.modelValue,
  (newVal) => {
    if (Array.isArray(newVal)) {
      localRange.value = newVal;
    }
  }
);

// Emit changes for regular input fields
const updateModel = (event: Event) => {
  const name = (event.target as HTMLInputElement).name;
  const value = (event.target as HTMLInputElement).value;
  emit("updateModel", name, value);
};

// Format date for range display
function formatDate(date: Date): string {
  const year = date.getFullYear();
  const month = (date.getMonth() + 1).toString().padStart(2, "0");
  const day = date.getDate().toString().padStart(2, "0");
  return `${year}-${month}-${day}`;
}

// Handle date range change
function onRangeChange(value: string[] | string) {
  if (Array.isArray(value) && value.length >= 2) {
    const startDate = formatDate(new Date(value[0]));
    const endDate = formatDate(new Date(value[value.length - 1]));
    emit("update", props.inputData.name, `${startDate} - ${endDate}`);
  } else {
    const singleDate = formatDate(new Date(value[0]));
    emit("update", props.inputData.name, `${singleDate} - ${singleDate}`);
  }
}

// Handle regular input blur event
const handleInput = (event: Event) => {
  const name = (event.target as HTMLInputElement).name;
  const value = (event.target as HTMLInputElement).value;
  emit("update", name, value);
};
</script>

<style scoped lang="scss">
@use "@/assets/styles/style" as *;
@use "@/assets/styles/input.scss";

.input-wrapper > input[type="checkbox"] {
  flex-direction: row-reverse;
}

input[type="checkbox"] {
  margin: 1rem;
}

  border: 1px solid red;
}

  content: " *";
  color: red;
}

}

  margin-bottom: 0.5rem;
  font-weight: bold;
}

.input {
  padding: 0.5rem;
  border-radius: 10px;
  font-size: 1rem;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
}

input {
  padding: 1rem 0.75rem;
  border-radius: 0.5rem;
  width: 100%;
}

span {
  position: relative;
}

.showError {
  font-size: 0.7rem;
  display: block;
}
</style>

Key Changes:

  1. Refined onRangeChange: The range now correctly handles both single date and date range inputs.

  2. Error Handling: Cleaned up the error handling to ensure that it is only triggered when errors exist.

  3. updateModel & handleInput: You can consolidate these into a single event handler, depending on the behavior you want.

  4. Date Formatting: Made the formatDate function more flexible and consistent.

This should improve your componentâ€™s readability, functionality, and flexibility.

  1. Poprawienie v-model dla v-text-field:

    • Zamiast v-model="modelValue", uÅ¼ywamy v-model="localValue". To zapewnia, Å¼e localValue jest powiÄ…zane z polem tekstowym i umoÅ¼liwia edytowanie wartoÅ›ci w tym polu.

    return;
